title: Can anyone recommend a good font lawyer to help write EULA's?
content: I've been getting requests for a variety of font licenses and I'm starting to realize that I should probably get professional help for this kind of stuff. Can anyone recommend a good lawyer that would know how to do this? Does anyone know what the typical EULA costs to write?
author: Christian Robertson

comments.content: The preeminent font lawyer is [Frank Martinez](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015112631/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frank%20Martinez), who is the counsel for [SOTA](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015112631/http:/typophile.com/wiki/SOTA) and various foundries.
If you're happy with the EULA Veer uses to license your work couldn't you re-use it? I'm sure Bill Gates would be okay with you doing so. ;-)
